Damien_Horne:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Damien Horne | image = DamienHorne2006-08-24.jpg | caption = Horne at the [[Cummins Station]] in [[Nashville, Tennessee]] on August 24, 2006 | occupation = Singer, songwriter | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|7|14}} | instrument = Vocals, guitar, piano | years_active = 2001-present | alias = Mista D | past_member_of = [[The Farm (American band)|The Farm]] | website = {{URL|https://www.damienhorne.com}} }} '''Damien Horne''', also known as '''Mista D'''{{cite web|url=http://www.upress.state.ms.us/books/1263 |title=MuzikMafia: From the Local Nashville Scene to the National Mainstream |publisher=Upress.state.ms.us |date= |accessdate=2014-08-10}} (born July 14, 1978) is an American recording artist, musician and songwriter. He is a member of the trio [[The Farm (U.S. band)|The Farm]], as well as [[Nashville]]'s [[MuzikMafia]],{{cite web |url=http://www.muzikmafia.com/artists_mistad.php |title=MuzikMafia : Muzik Without Prejudice |website=www.muzikmafia.com |access-date=14 January 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090202091838/http://www.muzikmafia.com/artists_mistad.php |archive-date=2 February 2009 |url-status=dead}} and is involved with the [[Salvation Army]], [[Samaritan's Feet]], and other humanitarian organizations. He has collaborated and performed with [[Melissa Manchester]], [[Bon Jovi]], [[Kid Rock]], [[John Legend]], [[Hank Williams, Jr.]] [[The Commodores]], [[3 Doors Down]], [[Faith Hill]], [[Big & Rich]], [[Shemekia Copeland]], [[Robert Randolph (guitarist)|Robert Randolph]], [[Jewel (singer)|Jewel]], [[Josh Kelley]], [[Gretchen Wilson]], [[Velvet Revolver]], and [[The Neville Brothers]].{{cite web |url=http://www.nowplayingnashville.com/event/detail/170937/Music_City_Soul_Series_featuring_Damien_Horne |title=Music City Soul Series featuring Damien Horne | Nashville Convention and Visitors Bureau | B.B. King's Blues Club and Restaurant | MUSIC |publisher=NowPlayingNashville.com |date=2010-02-04 |accessdate=2014-08-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812214311/http://www.nowplayingnashville.com/event/detail/170937/Music_City_Soul_Series_featuring_Damien_Horne |archive-date=2014-08-12 |url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=http://www.legendsandlyrics.com/artists/Damien_Horne |title=Legends and Lyrics // Songwriters in the Round // PBS Music Show |publisher=Legendsandlyrics.com |date= |accessdate=2014-08-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160130211028/http://www.legendsandlyrics.com/artists/Damien_Horne |archive-date=2016-01-30 |url-status=dead }} ==Career== He became a member of the [[MuzikMafia]] in 2001, and recorded his first album ''Somebody's Hero'' in 2008 under the direction and production of [[Big Kenny]] of [[Big & Rich]]. When asked about the project, [[Big Kenny]] said
"I have never met a more important artist for our times, completely real, unique, deserving and uplifting. I cannot stop until the world hears his music. He writes, he sings , he plays piano and guitar, he dances like 'the man' and you know it when he backflips off the stage in a way that would make James Brown proud."{{cite web|url=http://www.reverbnation.com/damienhorne |title=Damien Horne Music, Lyrics, Songs, and Videos |publisher=Reverbnation.com |date= |accessdate=2014-08-10}}
Horne signed a publishing deal with Big Love Music in 2007.{{cite web|url=http://www.bmi.com/news/entry/534270 |title=Big Kenny Signs Damien Horne to Big Love Music | News |publisher=BMI.com |date=2007-01-19 |accessdate=2014-08-10}} He has made appearances on One Cubed,{{cite web|url=http://s240778137.onlinehome.us/display.php?ID=398§ionID=26 |title=1 Cubed - Damien Horne - Biography, Interviews and Music Interviews |publisher=S240778137.onlinehome.us |date= |accessdate=2014-08-10}} [[The 700 Club]],{{cite web|url=http://www.cbn.com/media/player/index.aspx?s=/vod/ |title=CBN TV - Video On Demand |publisher=Cbn.com |date=2014-08-04 |accessdate=2014-08-10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.cbn.com/cbnmusic/interviews/700club_damienhorne042607.aspx |title=Damien Horne: The Saint of MuzikMafia |publisher=Cbn.com |date= |accessdate=2014-08-10}} and Legends & Lyrics, as well as appeared in [[Rolling Stone]] and on the cover of Lifeway Christian Singles magazine.{{Cite web |url=http://www.lifeway.com/lwc/mainpage/0%2C1701%2CM%25253D201021%2C00.html |title=| LifeWay |access-date=2010-04-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100210064913/http://www.lifeway.com/lwc/mainpage/0,1701,M=201021,00.html |archive-date=2010-02-10 |url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=http://www.damienhorne.com/index.php?page=news|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100529005858/http://www.damienhorne.com/index.php?page=news|url-status=dead|archive-date=29 May 2010|title=DAMIEN HORNE : News|date=29 May 2010|accessdate=4 August 2018}} In 2006, he and [[Keith Urban]] put together and directed a children's choir during the 2006 [[Country Music Television|CMT]] awards show in tribute to the victims of [[Hurricane Katrina]].{{cite web|url=http://www.muzikmafia.com/artists_bignrich_news.php|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081006080033/http://www.muzikmafia.com/artists_bignrich_news.php|url-status=dead|archive-date=6 October 2008|title=MuzikMafia : Muzik Without Prejudice|date=6 October 2008|accessdate=4 August 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://weather.thefuntimesguide.com/2005/09/katrina_photos.php |title=Katrina Photos: Everyday People Helping Hurricane Katrina Victims | The Fun Times Guide to Weather |publisher=Weather.thefuntimesguide.com |date=2005-09-17 |accessdate=2014-08-10}} In 2007, he made a trip along with fellow [[MuzikMafia]] member [[Big Kenny]] to [[Akon]] [[Sudan]]{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/news-in-brief/1572388/big-kenny-delivering-school-supplies-to-sudan.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110606085650/http://www.cmt.com/news/news-in-brief/1572388/big-kenny-delivering-school-supplies-to-sudan.jhtml |url-status=dead |archive-date=June 6, 2011 |title=News : Big Kenny Delivering School Supplies to Sudan |publisher=CMT |date=2007-10-19 |accessdate=2014-08-10}} to bring medical and school supplies, along with musical instruments, clothing and building tools to the Kunyuk School for Girls. In 2008, he appeared on ''[[Extreme Makeover Home Edition]]''[http://wsoctv.zipscene.com/events/view/487261-free-benefit-concert-for-extreme-home-makeover-charlotte-concerts ]{{dead link|date=August 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.americanheartlandhomes.com/extreme-makeover/extreme-makeover-home-edition-charlotte.aspx|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090606011525/http://www.americanheartlandhomes.com/extreme-makeover/extreme-makeover-home-edition-charlotte.aspx|url-status=dead|archive-date=6 June 2009|title=Extreme Makeover Home Edition Charlotte|date=6 June 2009|accessdate=4 August 2018}} working alongside the crew and people of [[Charlotte, North Carolina|Charlotte]] [[North Carolina]] to help build a house for the King family. In addition, he performed a benefit concert with his band to raise money for the family. Later in 2008, he walked 300 miles with Emmanuel "Manny" Ohonme performing nightly at each stop for the [[Samaritan's Feet]][http://www.samaritansfeet.com/blog/world-walk-start_1 ]{{dead link|date=August 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.samaritansfeet.org/ |title=Samaritans Feet |publisher=Samaritans Feet |date= |accessdate=2014-08-10}} organization to raise one million pairs of shoes for children. He also wrote and recorded the theme song for the organization produced and arranged by his keyboardist [[Chris Mendoza]].{{cite web|url=http://www.redorbit.com/news/technology/1589359/speakerheart_artist_damien_horne_joins_samaritans_feet_world_walk/ |title=Speakerheart Artist Damien Horne Joins Samaritan's Feet World Walk - Technology News |publisher=redOrbit |date=2008-10-16 |accessdate=2014-08-10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.samaritansfeet.org/news/a-walker-s-perspective|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090105212936/http://www.samaritansfeet.org/news/a-walker-s-perspective|url-status=dead|archive-date=5 January 2009|title=Samaritans Feet - Be a samaritan. Give a shoe. Change a life.|date=5 January 2009|accessdate=4 August 2018}} In 2009, he and [[Big Kenny]] hosted "[[Nashville]] 4 [[Africa]]",{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/country-music/1609910/nashville4africa-concert-brings-love-and-compassion-to-music-city.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090427133502/http://www.cmt.com/news/country-music/1609910/nashville4africa-concert-brings-love-and-compassion-to-music-city.jhtml |url-status=dead |archive-date=April 27, 2009 |title=News : Nashville4Africa Concert Brings Love and Compassion to Music City |publisher=CMT |date=2009-04-23 |accessdate=2014-08-10}}{{cite web |url=http://www.nowplayingnashville.com/event/detail/143425/Nashville4Africa_African_Childrens_Choir_w_Big_Kenny_Keith_Urban_Faith_Hill_Dierks_Bentley |title=Nashville4Africa African Childrens Choir w Big Kenny Keith Urban Faith Hill Dierks Bentley | The Community Foundation of Middle Tennessee | Schermerhorn Symphony Center | MUSIC |publisher=NowPlayingNashville.com |date=2009-04-22 |accessdate=2014-08-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812212207/http://www.nowplayingnashville.com/event/detail/143425/Nashville4Africa_African_Childrens_Choir_w_Big_Kenny_Keith_Urban_Faith_Hill_Dierks_Bentley |archive-date=2014-08-12 |url-status=dead}} with [[Faith Hill]], [[Keith Urban]], [[Dierks Bentley]], and [[Brad Arnold]] of [[3 Doors Down]]. A benefit concert to raise money for charitable causes in [[Uganda]] and [[Sudan]]. Horne's song "She Can Play" is the theme song for the [[Atlantic Coast Conference|ACC]].{{cite web |url=http://blogs.newsobserver.com/womenshoops/accs-theme-song-she-can-play |title=ACC's theme song: 'She Can Play' | newsobserver.com blogs |publisher=Blogs.newsobserver.com |date= |accessdate=2014-08-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120504200210/http://blogs.newsobserver.com/womenshoops/accs-theme-song-she-can-play |archive-date=2012-05-04 |url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=http://www.theacc.com/sports/w-baskbl/spec-rel/010810aaa.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120922085213/http://www.theacc.com/sports/w-baskbl/spec-rel/010810aaa.html|url-status=dead|archive-date=22 September 2012|title=Atlantic Coast Conference Unveils 'She Can Play' Remix - The Official Athletic Site of the Atlantic Coast Conference|date=22 September 2012|accessdate=4 August 2018}} Horne has also worked Singer-Songwriter [[John Legend]]. When asked about up and coming artists we should look out for, John said:
"I’ve been working with this guy who is based in Nashville, his name is Damien Horne, he’s good. Look out for him, he’s a good song-writer and performer. He plays the guitar too."{{cite web |author= |url=http://www.taletela.com/news/3284/john-legend-talks-kanye-west-amy-winehouse-and-justin-bieber |title=John Legend Talks Kanye West, Amy Winehouse And Justin Bieber |publisher=TaleTela |date=2010-10-15 |accessdate=2014-08-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812211912/http://www.taletela.com/news/3284/john-legend-talks-kanye-west-amy-winehouse-and-justin-bieber |archive-date=2014-08-12 |url-status=dead}}
In 2010, Horne contributed four tracks to Big Kenny's third solo album, ''Big Kenny's Love Everybody Traveling Musical Medicine Show Mix Tape, Vol. 1''. In 2011, Horne founded [[The Farm (U.S. band)|The Farm]] with [[Krista Marie]] and Nick Hoffman. ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} {{MuzikMafia}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Horne, Damien}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:African-American country musicians]] [[Category:African-American male songwriters]] [[Category:21st-century African-American male singers]] [[Category:21st-century American male singers]] [[Category:The Farm (American band) members]]
